alert.note: Alert for Craig; Mayes; Nowata; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 6:56AM CDT until June 14 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Craig County in northeastern Oklahoma... Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... South central Nowata County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 745 AM CDT. * At 656 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Chelsea to 2 miles southwest of Foyil to near Owasso, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Pryor... Owasso... Pryor Creek... Verdigris... Chouteau... Chelsea... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Foyil... Big Cabin... Pensacola... New Alluwe... Hoot Owl... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 241 and 275. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
